data.title: AUTOGRAPH. Werner von Heidenstam (1859-1940) Swedish writer and poet.
data.meta_description: He was a member of the Swedish Academy 1912–40 and was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1916. He debuted as a writer in 1888 with a collection of poems that broke with the then prevailing Swedish literary tradition of realism and naturalism, to instead focus on romance, individualism, sensu…
data.text: He was a member of the Swedish Academy 1912–40 and was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1916. He debuted as a writer in 1888 with a collection of poems that broke with the then prevailing Swedish literary tradition of realism and naturalism, to instead focus on romance, individualism, sensualism and the romanticization of Swedish great power history, with a particular focus on the fates of the Carolingian soldiers. Own written signed two-page letter to Dated 27 October 1901. The letter is in very good condition. Has been folded and is slightly torn at the joint.
